publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3348 Dennis Canavan: Opposition to Invasion of Iraq-That the Parliament is opposed to the invasion of Iraq by USA forces and calls on the Prime Minister to try to dissuade President Bush from such action, which would do incalculable damage to the cause of peace in the Middle East and would almost certainly destroy the lives of many innocent Iraqi people who are victims of the oppressive regime of Saddam Hussein.

S1M-3348# Dennis Canavan: Opposition to Invasion of Iraq-That the Parliament is opposed to the invasion of Iraq by USA forces and *believes that* the Prime Minister *should* try to dissuade President Bush from such action, which would do incalculable damage to the cause of peace in the Middle East and would almost certainly destroy the lives of many innocent Iraqi people who are victims of the oppressive regime of Saddam Hussein. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald*, Elaine Smith*, Robin Harper*
S1M-3348# Opposition to Invasion of Iraq (lodged on 3 September 2002) Mr John McAllion*, Fiona McLeod*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Adam Ingram*

S1M-3348# Dennis Canavan: Opposition to Invasion of Iraq-That the Parliament is opposed to the invasion of Iraq by USA forces and believes that the Prime Minister should try to dissuade President Bush from such action, which would do incalculable damage to the cause of peace in the Middle East and would almost certainly destroy the lives of many innocent Iraqi people who are victims of the oppressive regime of Saddam Hussein. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Elaine Smith, Robin Harper, Mr John McAllion, Fiona McLeod, Donald Gorrie, Mr Adam Ingram
S1M-3348# Opposition to Invasion of Iraq (lodged on 3 September 2002) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3348# Opposition to Invasion of Iraq (lodged on 3 September 2002) Christine Grahame*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Linda Fabiani*, Alex Neil*
S1M-3348# Opposition to Invasion of Iraq (lodged on 3 September 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3348# Opposition to Invasion of Iraq (lodged on 3 September 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3348# Opposition to Invasion of Iraq (lodged on 3 September 2002) Brian Adam*
